other.name: Outrider Gangs
other.description: Each time you use the Cult Ambush ability to set this unit back up on the battlefield, in addition to the normal rules, all of its models must be set up wholly within 9" of a battlefield edge and at least one of its models must be touching one of your Cult Ambush markers (that marker is then removed from the battlefield). If this cannot be done, this unit cannot be set back up.

other.name: Demolition Run
other.description: Once per turn, in your Movement phase, when this unit ends a Normal, Advance or Fall Back move, you can select one enemy unit within 6" of and visible to this unit and roll one D6 for each ATALAN JACKALS model in this unit: for each 4+, that enemy unit suffers 1 mortal wound (to a maximum of 6 mortal wounds).

composition: This unit can only contain 2 Atalan Wolfquads if it also contains 8 Atalan Jackals.*
datasheets.fluff: Atalan Jackals share a mental link that allows them to coordinate in hunting packs and ride in tight formations at high speeds with no risk of mishap. They harass the foe with hit-and-run strikes, their Wolfquads unleashing heavy firepower to augment the guns, bludgeons and mining charges of their packmates.
datasheets.loadout:
Every Atalan Jackal is equipped with: Atalan small arms; close combat weapon.
Every Atalan Wolfquad is equipped with: Atalan small arms; heavy stubber; close combat weapon.
datasheets.name: Atalan Jackals
wargear: Any number of Atalan Wolfquads can each have their heavy stubber replaced with one of the following: ◦ 1 Atalan incinerator ◦ 1 mining laser
For every 4 Atalan Jackals in this unit, 1 Atalan Jackal’s Atalan small arms can be replaced with 1 grenade launcher.
For every 4 Atalan Jackals in this unit, up to 2 Atalan Jackals’ close combat weapons can each be replaced with 1 Atalan power weapon.

other.name: Heroic Fusillade
other.description: Once per turn, after one model from your army with this ability has shot, you can select one INFANTRY unit hit by one or more of those attacks. That unit must take a Battle-shock test.

other.name: Hypersensory Abilities
other.description: Once per turn, in your opponent’s Movement phase, when an enemy unit ends a Normal, Advance or Fall Back move within 9" of this model, if this model is not within Engagement Range of one or more enemy units, it can shoot at that unit as if it were your Shooting phase and then make a Normal move of up to D6" (it cannot embark within a TRANSPORT as part of this move).

datasheets.fluff: This gunfighter is a living icon of rebellion, moulded to exploit the psyche of fractured Human societies. Whip-fast reactions and hypersensory acuity lend the Kelermorph lethal reaction speeds and help it unleash withering volleys from its iconic liberator autostubs, whose depleted volonium rounds can punch through tank armour.
datasheets.loadout: This model is equipped with: liberator autostubs; close combat weapon.
datasheets.name: Kelermorph
wargear: None

other.name: A Plan Generations in the Making
other.description: At the end of your Command phase, if this unit is within range of an objective marker you control, that objective marker remains under your control, even if you have no models within range of it, until your opponent controls it at the start or end of any turn.

wargear.name: Cult Icon
wargear.description: In your Command phase, you can return up to 3 destroyed models to the bearer’s unit. If the bearer’s unit is within range of an objective marker you control, you can return up to D3+3 destroyed models to that unit instead. This ability cannot be used to return destroyed CHARACTER models in Attached units and any [ONE SHOT] weapons equipped by returned models that were shot before they were destroyed are still considered to have been shot.

datasheets.fluff: Making up the bulk of their cult’s ranks, Neophyte Hybrids are the least alien in appearance of all the Patriarch’s brood. They are no less dangerous for this, however, and what they lack in weaponised bio-adaptations they make up for in numbers, massed firepower and zealous revolutionary fanaticism.
datasheets.loadout: Every model is equipped with: autopistol; Hybrid firearm; close combat weapon.
datasheets.name: Neophyte Hybrids
wargear: The Neophyte Leader’s Hybrid firearm and close combat weapon can be replaced with 1 of the following: ◦ 1 anointed pistol and 1 chainsword  ◦ 1 anointed pistol and 1 power weapon

For every 10 models in this unit, up to 2 Neophyte Hybrids can each have their Hybrid firearm replaced with one of the following:  ◦ Flamer ◦ Grenade launcher ◦ Webber   To a maximum of 1 per 10 models in this unit.

For every 10 models in this unit, up to 2 Neophyte Hybrids can each have their Hybrid firearm replaced with one of the following:  ◦ Heavy stubber ◦ Mining laser ◦ Seismic cannon   To a maximum of 1 per 10 models in this unit.
One Neophyte Hybrid equipped with a Hybrid firearm can be equipped with 1 cult icon.

other.name: Voice of New Truths
other.description: In your Command phase, one model from your army with this ability can use it. If it does, select one enemy unit within 18" of it; that enemy unit must take a Battle-shock test.

other.name: Scrambler Array
other.description: Enemy units that are set up on the battlefield as Reinforcements cannot be set up within 12" of this model.

datasheets.fluff: Vox-hacker and information assassin supreme, the Clamavus scythes into enemy communications networks and plunders them for intelligence. It seeds the amplified psychic signal of the Broodmind through the foe’s comms to spread dismay from a distance, while up close it can rupture its victims’ brains with its savage audial symphony.
datasheets.leader: This model can be attached to the following units: ■ ACOLYTE HYBRIDS ■ HYBRID METAMORPHS ■ NEOPHYTE HYBRIDS You can attach this model to an ACOLYTE HYBRIDS or NEOPHYTE HYBRIDS unit, even if a PRIMUS, MAGUS or ACOLYTE ICONWARD model has already been attached to it. If you do, and that Bodyguard unit is destroyed, the Leader units attached to it become separate units, with their original Starting Strengths.
datasheets.loadout: This model is equipped with: autopistol; close combat weapon.
datasheets.name: Clamavus
wargear: None

leads.extra: You can attach this model to an ACOLYTE HYBRIDS or NEOPHYTE HYBRIDS unit, even if a PRIMUS, MAGUS or ACOLYTE ICONWARD model has already been attached to it. If you do, and that Bodyguard unit is destroyed, the Leader units attached to it become separate units, with their original Starting Strengths.

other.name: Primed and Ready
other.description: In your Shooting phase, you can select one model from your army with this ability as the target of the Grenade Stratagem for 0CP, provided that model has not already been the target of that Stratagem this phase.

other.name: Planted Explosives
other.description:
Once per battle, when an enemy unit ends a Normal, Advance or Fall Back move within 9" of this model, this model can use its Reductus mine. If it does, roll one D6: on a 2+, that enemy unit suffers D3+3 mortal wounds. Only one model from your army with this ability can use it in the same battle round.

Designer’s Note: Place a Reductus Mine token next to the model, removing it once this ability has been used.

datasheets.fluff: There is no engine of the oppressors that a Reductus Saboteur cannot lay low, and few materials they cannot fashion into a bomb given a little time to tinker. Flitting through the shadows, they lace the battlefield with booby traps and deploy powerful explosives that make short work of enemy armour.
datasheets.loadout: This model is equipped with: autopistol; demolition charges; remote explosives; close combat weapon.
datasheets.name: Reductus Saboteur

abilities.name: One Shot
abilities.description: The bearer can only shoot with this weapon once per battle.

wargear: None

other.name: Might From Beyond
other.description: While this model is leading a unit, melee weapons equipped by models in that unit have the [DEVASTATING WOUNDS] ability.

other.name: Cosmic Horror (Psychic)
other.description: At the start of the Fight phase, each enemy unit within 6" of this model must take a Battle-shock test.

other.name: Psychic Familiar
other.description:
Once per battle, at the start of the Fight phase, this model can use its psychic familiar. If it does, until the end of the phase, add 6" to the range of its Cosmic Horror ability.

Designer’s Note: Place a Psychic Familiar token next to the model, removing it once this ability has been used.

special.description:
■ You cannot include more than one PATRIARCH model in your army.
■ If this model is in your army, it must be your WARLORD.
special.name: Supreme Commander

datasheets.fluff: Psychic abomination; alpha predator; parasitic demigod – the Patriarch is all of these things and worse. They are the source of the bio corruption that spawns each Genestealer Cult cell. Moreover, when the Day of Ascension comes, they are the cult’s deadliest killer, prowling the shadows of embattled worlds to rip and slay.
datasheets.leader: This model can be attached to the following unit: ■ PURESTRAIN GENESTEALERS
datasheets.loadout: This model is equipped with: Patriarch’s claws.
datasheets.name: Patriarch
wargear: None

other.name: Fire Support
other.description: In your Shooting phase, after this model has shot, select one enemy unit it scored one or more hits against this phase. Until the end of the phase, each time a friendly model that disembarked from this TRANSPORT this turn makes an attack that targets that enemy unit, you can re-roll the Wound roll.

datasheets.fluff: Robust and versatile, the Goliath Truck is the armoured transport of choice for the Genestealer Cults. These vehicles boast thick armour and capacious holds, and their heavy stubber and twin autocannon allow the crew to lay down a hail of supporting fire as the broodkin passengers disembark into battle.
datasheets.loadout: This model is equipped with: heavy stubber; twin autocannon; demolition charge cache; armoured hull.
datasheets.name: Goliath Truck
datasheets.transport: This model has a transport capacity of 12 GENESTEALER CULTS INFANTRY models.
wargear: None

other.name: Twisted Science
other.description: While this model is leading a unit, melee weapons equipped by models in that unit have the [LETHAL HITS] ability.

other.name: Biological Warfare
other.description: Once per battle, when this model’s unit is selected to fight, this model can use this ability. If it does, until the end of the phase, improve the Attacks and Damage characteristics of its injector goad by 3.

wargear.name: Alchemicus Familiar
wargear.description: Once per battle, when the bearer’s unit is selected to fight, the bearer can use its alchemicus familiar. If it does, until the end of the phase, each time a model in the bearer’s unit makes an attack that targets an INFANTRY unit, add 1 to the Wound roll.

datasheets.fluff: The Biophagus is a scientist-surgeon whose injector goad can be used to enhance the unholy might of Aberrants and other favoured cultists, or to dose enemies with a mutagenic cocktail that rapidly dissolves them from within. Coupled with hurled vials of bio-acids, this arsenal renders the Biophagus a deadly agent of biological warfare.
datasheets.leader: This model can be attached to the following units: ■ ABERRANTS ■ ACOLYTE HYBRIDS ■ HYBRID METAMORPHS ■ NEOPHYTE HYBRIDS You can attach this model to an ACOLYTE HYBRIDS or NEOPHYTE HYBRIDS unit, even if a PRIMUS, MAGUS or ACOLYTE ICONWARD model has already been attached to it. If you do, and that Bodyguard unit is destroyed, the Leader units attached to it become separate units, with their original Starting Strengths.
datasheets.loadout: This model is equipped with: autopistol; chemical vials; injector goad; alchemicus familiar.
datasheets.name: Biophagus
wargear: None

leads.extra: You can attach this model to an ACOLYTE HYBRIDS or NEOPHYTE HYBRIDS unit, even if a PRIMUS, MAGUS or ACOLYTE ICONWARD model has already been attached to it. If you do, and that Bodyguard unit is destroyed, the Leader units attached to it become separate units, with their original Starting Strengths.

other.name: Nexus of Devotion
other.description: While this model is leading a unit, models in that unit have the Feel No Pain 5+ ability. If that unit has the HYBRID METAMORPHS keyword, models in that unit have the Feel No Pain 4+ ability instead.

other.name: Summon the Cult
other.description: Once per battle, when you have to remove a Cult Ambush marker because your opponent has moved too close to it, if one or more models from your army with this ability are on the battlefield, you can use this ability. If you do, instead of removing that marker, you can place it anywhere on the battlefield that is within 12" of a model from your army with this ability and more than 9" horizontally away from all enemy units (if this is not possible, this ability is not considered to have been used and that marker is removed as normal).

datasheets.fluff: It is a great honour to bear the cult’s sigil aloft, out in the open for all to see. These banners are hung with pseudo-sacred artefacts, some stemming from the secretions or body of the Patriarch itself. The effect of the Acolyte Iconward’s presence upon nearby cult warriors is electrifying, driving them to new heights of violence.
datasheets.leader: This model can be attached to the following units: ■ ACOLYTE HYBRIDS ■ HYBRID METAMORPHS ■ NEOPHYTE HYBRIDS
datasheets.loadout: This model is equipped with: autopistol; cult claws.
datasheets.name: Acolyte Iconward
wargear: None

other.name: Crossfire
other.description: In your Shooting phase, after this unit has shot, select one enemy unit hit by one or more of those attacks. Until the end of the turn, each time a friendly GENESTEALER CULTS unit makes an attack that targets that enemy unit, improve the Armour Penetration characteristic of that attack by 1. The same enemy unit can only be affected by this ability once per turn.

wargear.name: Flare launcher
wargear.description: The bearer’s unit has the SMOKE keyword and you can target it with the Smokescreen Stratagem for 0CP.

wargear.name: Spotter
wargear.description: The bearer’s ranged weapons have a Ballistic Skill characteristic of 3+.

wargear.name: Survey Augur
wargear.description: Each time the bearer’s unit has shot, select one enemy unit that was hit by one or more attacks made by the bearer this phase. Until the end of the phase, each time a friendly GENESTEALER CULTS model makes an attack against that unit, that attack has the [IGNORES COVER] ability.

datasheets.fluff: The operators of these lightweight but rugged scout vehicles help to coordinate lethal armoured ambushes that eliminate isolated foes or sever communication and supply lines. They can mount a versatile range of heavy weapons, and their speed and manoeuvrability enable them to skirt enemy ranks before unleashing their payloads at a more vulnerable quarter.
datasheets.loadout: Every model is equipped with: heavy mining laser; twin heavy stubbers; armoured hull; flare launcher.
datasheets.name: Achilles Ridgerunners
wargear: Any number of models can each have their flare launcher replaced with one of the following: ◦ 1 spotter ◦ 1 survey augur
Any number of models can each have their heavy mining laser replaced with one of the following:  ◦ 1 Achilles missile launcher ◦ 1 heavy mortar

other.name: Cult Demagogue
other.description: While this model is leading a unit, each time a model in that unit makes an attack, you can re-roll the Hit roll.

other.name: Decoys and Misdirection
other.description: If your army includes one or more models with this ability, after both players have deployed their armies, select up to three GENESTEALER CULTS units from your army and redeploy them. When doing so, you can set those units up in Strategic Reserves if you wish, regardless of how many units are already in Strategic Reserves.

datasheets.fluff: Occupying a role somewhere between guerrilla general and shadowy symbol of resistance, the Primus is a Genestealer Cult’s ultimate military commander. Besides being deadly combatants in their own right, their mastery of insurgent tactics transforms their followers from a rebellious mob into a lethal military machine.
datasheets.leader: This model can be attached to the following units: ■ ACOLYTE HYBRIDS ■ HYBRID METAMORPHS ■ NEOPHYTE HYBRIDS
datasheets.loadout: This model is equipped with: scoped needle pistol; cult bonesword; toxin injector claw.
datasheets.name: Primus
wargear: None

other.name: The Chosen One
other.description: While this model is leading a unit, each time a model in that unit is destroyed by a melee attack, if that model has not fought this phase, roll one D6. On a 4+, do not remove the destroyed model from play; it can fight after the attacking model’s unit has finished making its attacks, and is then removed from play.

other.name: Regenerating Gene-mass
other.description: The first time this model is destroyed, roll one D6 at the end of the phase. On a 2+, set this model back up on the battlefield as close as possible to where it was destroyed and not within Engagement Range of any enemy units, with its full wounds remaining.

datasheets.fluff: Born from the sting of a mindwyrm familiar, the Abominant is an Aberrant tainted with the Patriarch’s own gene-mass. This transforms the beast into a mountain of mutated chitin and muscle that can regenerate as swiftly as its foes can harm it, and whose raw might is a lethal battlefield asset.
datasheets.leader: This model can be attached to the following unit: ■ ABERRANTS
datasheets.loadout: This model is equipped with: power sledgehammer.
datasheets.name: Abominant
wargear: None

other.name: Battlefield Analysis
other.description: Once per battle round, one model from your army with this ability can use it when its unit is targeted with a Stratagem. If it does, reduce the CP cost of that use of that Stratagem by 1CP.

other.name: Cult Infiltration
other.description: At the start of each player’s Command phase, if this model is on the battlefield, you can select one of your Cult Ambush markers that is on the battlefield and has not been moved this turn and move it up to 6".

datasheets.fluff: Engineered to share a portion of the Patriarch’s cerebral might, the Nexos acts as their cult’s central nervous system. They use their comrades’ memories to craft strategic instructions and deployment orders. When they require a first-hand view of an engagement, they emerge into the light accompanied by cult bodyguards, directing assaults with all the expertise of a skilled field marshal.
datasheets.leader: This model can be attached to the following units: ■ ACOLYTE HYBRIDS ■ HYBRID METAMORPHS ■ NEOPHYTE HYBRIDS You can attach this model to an ACOLYTE HYBRIDS or NEOPHYTE HYBRIDS unit, even if a PRIMUS, MAGUS or ACOLYTE ICONWARD model has already been attached to it. If you do, and that Bodyguard unit is destroyed, the Leader units attached to it become separate units, with their original Starting Strengths.
datasheets.loadout: This model is equipped with: autopistol; close combat weapon.
datasheets.name: Nexos
wargear: None

leads.extra: You can attach this model to an ACOLYTE HYBRIDS or NEOPHYTE HYBRIDS unit, even if a PRIMUS, MAGUS or ACOLYTE ICONWARD model has already been attached to it. If you do, and that Bodyguard unit is destroyed, the Leader units attached to it become separate units, with their original Starting Strengths.

other.name: Creeping Shadow
other.description: If this model is equipped with a cult sniper rifle, once per turn, when an enemy unit ends a Normal, Advance or Fall Back move within 9" of this model, if this model is not within Engagement Range of one or more enemy units, it can make a Normal move of up to 6".

other.name: Cloaked Assassin
other.description: If this model is equipped with a Sanctus bio-dagger, enemy units cannot use the Fire Overwatch Stratagem to shoot at this model.

other.name: Psychic Spoor
other.description: At the start of the first battle round, select one enemy unit to be this model’s prey. Each time this model makes an attack that targets its prey, you can re-roll the Hit roll and you can re-roll the Wound roll.

datasheets.fluff: A Sanctus is an inescapable assassin who can track by psychic spoor and squirm through the smallest gaps. Its bio-dagger – spawned from the Patriarch’s genesis pools – unleashes the psychic might of the Broodmind with the slightest cut, while the Sanctus’ cult sniper rifle allows it to strike down prey from afar.
datasheets.loadout: This model is equipped with: Sanctus bio-dagger.
datasheets.name: Sanctus
wargear: This model’s Sanctus bio-dagger can be replaced with 1 cult sniper rifle and 1 close combat weapon.

other.name: Priority Target
other.description: In your Shooting phase, after this model’s unit has shot, select one enemy unit hit by one or more of those attacks made with a cult sniper rifle. Until the end of the phase, each time a friendly GENESTEALER CULTS model makes an attack that targets that enemy unit, re-roll a Hit roll of 1.

other.name: Master Outrider
other.description: In your Shooting phase, after this model’s unit has shot, if it is not within Engagement Range of any enemy units, that unit can make a Normal move of up to 6" as if it were your Movement phase. If it does, until the end of the turn, that unit is not eligible to declare a charge.

datasheets.fluff: The Jackal Alphus rides their dirtcycle to commanding battlefield vantage points. With their long-range vox, the Alphus calls in strike missions against tougher, armoured targets. Should a foe fall beneath the cross hairs of their cult sniper rifle, its life expectancy can be measured in moments.
datasheets.leader: This model can be attached to the following unit: ■ ATALAN JACKALS
datasheets.loadout: This model is equipped with: autopistol; cult sniper rifle; close combat weapon.
datasheets.name: Jackal Alphus
wargear: None

other.name: Hulking Bodyguards
other.description: While a CHARACTER is leading this unit, each time an attack targets this unit, if the Strength characteristic of that attack is greater than the Toughness characteristic of this unit, subtract 1 from the Wound roll.

datasheets.fluff: No-one truly knows what causes Aberrants to spring up amidst the brood cycle, yet the uses of these lumpen gene-deviants are obvious. Possessed of immense strength and resilience coupled with simplistic loyalty to the cult, they are hurled into battle as line breakers or massed as hulking, expendable bodyguards.
datasheets.loadout: Every model is equipped with: Aberrant weapons.
datasheets.name: Aberrants
wargear: None

other.name: Claimed for the Cult
other.description: At the start of your Command phase, roll one D6 for each objective marker you control that has one or more units from your army with this ability within range of it. If one or more of the results is a 4+, you gain 1CP.

wargear.name: Cult Icon
wargear.description: In your Command phase, you can return up to D3 destroyed models to the bearer’s unit. If the bearer’s unit is within range of an objective marker you control, you can return up to 3 destroyed models to that unit instead. This ability cannot be used to return destroyed CHARACTER models in Attached units and any [ONE SHOT] weapons equipped by returned models that were shot before they were destroyed are still considered to have been shot.

datasheets.fluff: Acolyte Hybrids comprise the earliest generations of a cult’s brood cycles, and they are monstrous in body and mind. Some equip themselves with an array of automatic pistols and repurposed heavy tools, applying industrialised might to the battlefield in acts of sabotage or resource acquisition.
datasheets.loadout: Every model is equipped with: autopistol; cult claws and knife.
datasheets.name: Acolyte Hybrids with Autopistols
wargear: The Acolyte Leader’s cult claws and knife can be replaced with 1 Leader’s bio-weapons.
For every 5 models in this unit, up to 3 Acolyte Hybrids can each have their autopistol and cult claws and knife replaced with 1 heavy mining tool.
One Acolyte Hybrid’s autopistol can be replaced with 1 cult icon.

other.name: Brood Surge
other.description:
Each time an enemy unit is selected to shoot, after that unit has shot, if any models from this unit were destroyed as a result of those attacks, this unit can make a Brood Surge move. To do so, roll one D6: this unit can be moved a number of inches up to the result, but it must end that move as close as possible to the closest enemy unit (excluding AIRCRAFT). When doing so, those models can be moved within Engagement Range of that enemy unit.

If, at the start of the battle, no model in this unit is equipped with a hand flamer, each time this unit makes a Brood Surge move, it can be moved up to 6" instead of up to D6". A unit cannot make a Brood Surge move while it is Battle-shocked.

wargear.name: Cult Icon
wargear.description: In your Command phase, you can return up to D3 destroyed models to the bearer’s unit. If the bearer’s unit is within range of an objective marker you control, you can return up to 3 destroyed models to that unit instead. This ability cannot be used to return destroyed CHARACTER models in Attached units and any [ONE SHOT] weapons equipped by returned models that were shot before they were destroyed are still considered to have been shot.

datasheets.fluff: Triggered by the approach of a hive fleet or a sudden trauma to the cult, Hybrid Metamorphs mutate from early generations of the brood cycle. Dormant gene-codes burst to life, bestowing weaponised limbs, ghastly bio-acidic glands and other so-called blessings upon these creatures, transforming them into devastating shock troops for the cult.
datasheets.loadout:
The Metamorph Leader is equipped with: autopistol; Leader’s cult weapons.
Every Hybrid Metamorph is equipped with: autopistol; Metamorph mutations.
datasheets.name: Hybrid Metamorphs
wargear: One Hybrid Metamorph’s autopistol can be replaced with 1 cult icon.
Any number of models can each have their autopistol replaced with 1 hand flamer.

other.name: Industrialised Destruction
other.description: Each time a model in this unit makes an attack, re-roll a Wound roll of 1. If the target of that attack is an enemy unit within range of an objective marker, you can re-roll the Wound roll.

wargear.name: Cult Icon
wargear.description: In your Command phase, you can return up to D3 destroyed models to the bearer’s unit. If the bearer’s unit is within range of an objective marker you control, you can return up to 3 destroyed models to that unit instead. This ability cannot be used to return destroyed CHARACTER models in Attached units and any [ONE SHOT] weapons equipped by returned models that were shot before they were destroyed are still considered to have been shot.

datasheets.fluff: Equipped with hand flamers and using their hulking strength and xenos dexterity to wield pilfered explosive charges, Acolyte Hybrids excel in bold missions of arson and ruination. Denying the oppressors any opportunity of a foothold, their destructive acts are often so wholesale that few witnesses survive their operations.
datasheets.loadout: Every model is equipped with: hand flamer; cult claws and knife.
datasheets.name: Acolyte Hybrids with Hand Flamers

abilities.name: One Shot
abilities.description: The bearer can only shoot with this weapon once per battle.

wargear: The Acolyte Leader’s cult claws and knife can be replaced with 1 Leader’s bio-weapons.
For every 5 models in this unit, up to 2 Acolyte Hybrids can each have their hand flamer replaced with 1 demolition charges.
One Acolyte Hybrid’s hand flamer can be replaced with 1 cult icon.

other.name: Sudden Assault
other.description: While this model is leading a unit, models in that unit have the Fights First ability.

other.name: Bodyguard
other.description: While this model is leading a unit, other CHARACTER models attached to that unit have the Feel No Pain 4+ ability.

datasheets.fluff: An unassuming bodyguard, the Locus may be overlooked by the foe until the exact moment it abandons calm stillness for lightning-fast attack. Robes thrown back, the Locus’ whipping tail barb and vestigial limbs are revealed even as its twin blades flash out to neutralise any threats to its ward.
datasheets.leader: This model can be attached to the following units: ■ ACOLYTE HYBRIDS ■ HYBRID METAMORPHS ■ NEOPHYTE HYBRIDS You can attach this model to an ACOLYTE HYBRIDS or NEOPHYTE HYBRIDS unit, even if a PRIMUS, MAGUS or ACOLYTE ICONWARD model has already been attached to it. If you do, and that Bodyguard unit is destroyed, the Leader units attached to it become separate units, with their original Starting Strengths.
datasheets.loadout: This model is equipped with: Locus blades.
datasheets.name: Locus
wargear: None

leads.extra: You can attach this model to an ACOLYTE HYBRIDS or NEOPHYTE HYBRIDS unit, even if a PRIMUS, MAGUS or ACOLYTE ICONWARD model has already been attached to it. If you do, and that Bodyguard unit is destroyed, the Leader units attached to it become separate units, with their original Starting Strengths.

damaged.description: While this model has 1-3 wounds remaining, each time this model makes an attack, subtract 1 from the Hit roll.

other.name: Grinding Line-breaker
other.description: Each time an enemy unit (excluding MONSTERS and VEHICLES) that is within Engagement Range of this model Falls Back, all models in that enemy unit must take a Desperate Escape test. When doing so, if that enemy unit is Battle-shocked, subtract 1 from each of those tests.

datasheets.fluff: The drilldozer blade fitted to the Goliath Rockgrinder is intended for gouging tunnels deep into solid rock faces in search of mineral riches. However, it works just as well as both an ablative shield and a hideously bloody line-breaking weapon, mangling a crimson path through the luckless foe.
datasheets.loadout: This model is equipped with: heavy mining laser; heavy stubber; drilldozer blade; demolition charge cache.
datasheets.name: Goliath Rockgrinder
datasheets.transport: This model has a transport capacity of 6 GENESTEALER CULTS INFANTRY models.
wargear: This model’s heavy mining laser can be replaced with one of the following:  ◦ 1 clearance incinerator ◦ 1 heavy seismic cannon

other.name: Bio‐horror Disruption (Psychic)
other.description: While this model is leading a unit, ranged weapons equipped by models in that unit have the [LETHAL HITS] ability.

other.name: Psionic Shield (Psychic)
other.description: Once per battle, at the start of any phase, this model can use this ability. If it does, until the end of the phase, this model has a 4+ invulnerable save.

datasheets.fluff: A Benefictus uses the swollen mass of their brain to focus the will of the Broodmind. They unleash it in a lancing beam of incredible power that has the potential to carve through battle tank armour. Where the psionic strike hits, intense shock waves of nauseating alien horror spread out, leaving survivors vulnerable to lurking broodkin.
datasheets.leader: This model can be attached to the following units: ■ ACOLYTE HYBRIDS ■ HYBRID METAMORPHS ■ NEOPHYTE HYBRIDS
datasheets.loadout: This model is equipped with: Psionic Cascade; close combat weapon.
datasheets.name: Benefictus
wargear: None

other.name: Swift and Deadly
other.description: This unit is eligible to declare a charge in a turn in which it Advanced.

datasheets.fluff: Vanguard organisms for the Tyranid hive fleets, Purestrain Genestealers are one of the most lethal life forms in the galaxy. They combine the cunning of an apex predator with inhuman speed and agility, closing with their prey in the blink of an eye before tearing their victims to bloody tatters.
datasheets.loadout: Every model is equipped with: cult claws and talons.
datasheets.name: Purestrain Genestealers
wargear: None

other.name: Spiritual Leader
other.description: Once per battle, at the start of any phase, you can select one friendly GENESTEALER CULTS unit that is Battle-shocked and within 12" of this model. That unit is no longer Battle shocked.

other.name: Mind Control (Psychic)
other.description: At the start of your opponent’s Shooting phase, one PSYKER model from your army with this ability can use it. If used, select one enemy unit within 18" of that PSYKER model and roll one D6: on a 1, that PSYKER model suffers D3 mortal wounds; on a 2-5, until the end of the phase, each time a model in that enemy unit makes an attack, subtract 1 from the Hit roll; on a 6, each time a model in that enemy unit makes an attack, subtract 1 from the Hit roll and subtract 1 from the Wound roll.

other.name: Psychic Familiar
other.description:
Once per battle, at the start of your opponent’s Shooting phase, this model can use its psychic familiar. If it does, until the end of the phase, add 6" to the range of its Mind Control ability.

Designer’s Note: Place a Psychic Familiar token next to the model, removing it once this ability has been used.

datasheets.fluff: The Magus acts as its Patriarch’s vizier, and as the head of that alien monstrosity’s deviant church. Each one is a powerful psyker, their formidable will enhanced by the gestalt powers of the Star Children until they can manipulate enemies’ minds and bodies like puppets – or tear them apart from within.
datasheets.leader: This model can be attached to the following units: ■ ACOLYTE HYBRIDS ■ HYBRID METAMORPHS ■ NEOPHYTE HYBRIDS
datasheets.loadout: This model is equipped with: autopistol; force stave.
datasheets.name: Magus
wargear: None

other.description: Each time a ranged attack is allocated to a model, if that model is not fully visible to every model in the attacking unit because of this Fortification, that model has the Benefit of Cover against that attack.
other.name: Manufactorum Cover

other.description: Each time one of your Cult Ambush markers is removed as the result of an enemy unit ending any kind of move within 9" of it, you can instead move that marker so that it is wholly within 9" of this Fortification and more than 9" horizontally away from all enemy units (if this is not possible, that marker is removed as normal).
other.name: Underground Egress

other.description: Friendly Genestealer Cult Infantry models can be set up or end any type of move on top of the floor sections of this Fortification.
other.name: Tectonic Fragdrill

abilities.description: While an enemy unit is only within Engagement Range of one or more Fortifications from your army: ■  That unit can still be selected as the target of ranged attacks, but each time such an attack is made, unless it is made with a Pistol, subtract 1 from the Hit roll. ■  Models in that unit do not need to take Desperate Escape tests due to Falling Back while Battle-shocked, except for those that will move over enemy models when doing so.
abilities.name: FORTIFICATION

datasheets.loadout: This model is equipped with: fragdrill.
datasheets.name: Tectonic Fragdrill
wargear: None

enhancements.name: Prowling Agitant
enhancements.description: GENESTEALER CULTS model only. Once per turn, when an enemy unit ends a Normal, Advance or Fall Back move within 9" of the bearer’s unit, if the bearer’s unit is not within Engagement Range of any enemy units, it can make a Normal move of up to D6".

enhancements.name: A Chink In Their Armour
enhancements.description: GENESTEALER CULTS model only. Each time the bearer is set up on the battlefield as Reinforcements, until the end of your next Fight phase, ranged weapons equipped by models in the bearer’s unit have the [LETHAL HITS] ability.

enhancements.name: Our Time is Nigh
enhancements.description: GENESTEALER CULTS model only. Once per battle, when the bearer’s unit declares a charge, the bearer can use this Enhancement. If it does, until the end of the phase, add 2 to Charge rolls made for the bearer’s unit.

enhancements.name: Assassination Edict
enhancements.description: GENESTEALER CULTS model only. Each time a model in the bearer’s unit makes an attack that targets a CHARACTER unit, add 1 to the Hit roll.

enhancements.name: Gene-sire’s Reliquant
enhancements.description: MAGUS, PRIMUS or ACOLYTE ICONWARD model only. You can re‐roll Battle‐shock tests taken for the bearer’s unit.

enhancements.name: Denunciator of Tyrants
enhancements.description: MAGUS, PRIMUS or ACOLYTE ICONWARD model only. Each time a model in the bearer’s unit makes an attack that targets a CHARACTER unit, add 1 to the Hit roll and add 1 to the Wound roll.

enhancements.name: Deeds that Speak to the Masses
enhancements.description: MAGUS, PRIMUS or ACOLYTE ICONWARD model only. You start the battle with 2 additional Resurgence points.

enhancements.name: Incendiary Inspiration
enhancements.description: MAGUS, PRIMUS or ACOLYTE ICONWARD model only. The bearer’s unit is eligible to declare a charge in a turn in which it Advanced.

enhancements.name: Predatory Instincts
enhancements.description: ABOMINANT, BIOPHAGUS or PATRIARCH model only. Models in the bearer’s unit have the Infiltrators ability and, once per battle round, you can target the bearer’s unit with the Heroic Intervention Stratagem for 0CP, and can do so even if you have already targeted a different unit with that Stratagem this phase.

enhancements.name: Biomorph Adaptation
enhancements.description: ABOMINANT or PATRIARCH model only. Improve the Armour Penetration and Damage characteristics of melee weapons equipped by the bearer by 1.

enhancements.name: Mutagenic Regeneration
enhancements.description: ABOMINANT, BIOPHAGUS or PATRIARCH model only. In each Command phase, one model in the bearer’s unit regains 1 lost wound.

enhancements.name: Alien Majesty
enhancements.description: ABOMINANT, BIOPHAGUS or PATRIARCH model only. While an enemy unit is within Engagement Range of the bearer’s unit, subtract 1 from the Objective Control characteristic of models in that enemy unit (to a minimum of 1).

enhancements.name: Serpentine Tactics
enhancements.description: GENESTEALER CULTS MOUNTED model only. The bearer’s unit is eligible to shoot in a turn in which it Fell Back.

enhancements.name: Cartographic Data-leech
enhancements.description: GENESTEALER CULTS model only. While the bearer is embarked within a TRANSPORT, each time that TRANSPORT is selected to shoot, until the end of the phase, improve the Ballistic Skill characteristic of ranged weapons equipped by that TRANSPORT as a result of the Firing Deck ability by 1.

enhancements.name: Starfall Shells
enhancements.description: GENESTEALER CULTS MOUNTED model only. In your Shooting phase, after the bearer has shot, select one enemy unit hit by one or more of those attacks made with a cult sniper rifle. Until the start of your next Shooting phase, each time a model in that enemy unit makes an attack, subtract 1 from the Hit roll.

enhancements.name: Assault Commando
enhancements.description: GENESTEALER CULTS model only. Each time a model in the bearer’s unit makes a ranged attack, if it disembarked from a TRANSPORT this turn, you can re‐roll the Hit roll.

enhancements.name: Martial Espionage
enhancements.description: GENESTEALER CULTS INFANTRY model only. Once per turn, when a friendly ASTRA MILITARUM INFANTRY or ASTRA MILITARUM MOUNTED unit within 9" of the bearer is selected to shoot, the bearer can use this Enhancement. If it does, until the end of the phase, improve the Armour Penetration characteristic of ranged weapons equipped by models in that unit by 1.

enhancements.name: Adaptive Reprisal
enhancements.description: GENESTEALER CULTS INFANTRY model only. Once per turn, you can target a friendly GENESTEALER CULTS unit within 9" of the bearer with the Heroic Intervention Stratagem for 0CP.

enhancements.name: The Hero Returned
enhancements.description: GENESTEALER CULTS INFANTRY model only. Improve the Leadership and Objective Control characteristics of models in the bearer’s unit by 1.

enhancements.name: Fire-point Commander
enhancements.description: GENESTEALER CULTS INFANTRY model only. Each time you target the bearer’s unit with the Fire Overwatch Stratagem, while resolving that Stratagem, hits are scored on unmodified Hit rolls of 5+.

enhancements.name: Synaptic Auger
enhancements.description: TYRANIDS model only. Each time the bearer would regain one or more lost wounds from the Psionic Parasitism Detachment rule, it regains up to twice that number of lost wounds instead.

enhancements.name: Enraptured Damnation
enhancements.description: GENESTEALER CULTS model only. Enemy units cannot use the Fire Overwatch Stratagem to shoot at the bearer’s unit.

enhancements.name: Vanguard Tyrant
enhancements.description: WINGED HIVE TYRANT model only. Improve the Strength and Armour Penetration characteristics of melee weapons equipped by the bearer by 1.

enhancements.name: Inhuman Integration
enhancements.description: GENESTEALER CULTS model only. Weapons equipped by models in the bearer’s unit have the [SUSTAINED HITS 1] ability while targeting an enemy unit within 6" of one or more friendly TYRANIDS units.

stratagems.name: Symbiotic Destruction
stratagems.target: One ASTRA MILITARUM and one GENESTEALER CULTS unit from your army that have not been selected to shoot this phase.
stratagems.when: Your Shooting phase.
stratagems.effect: Select one enemy unit that is visible to both of those selected units and within range of at least one ranged weapon from each of those units. Until the end of the phase, models in those units can only make attacks that target that enemy unit (and only if it is an eligible target). When doing so, each time such a model makes an attack, re-roll a Wound roll of 1.
stratagems.fluff: As the Broodmind coordinates their timing, martial and insurrectionist comrades target their chosen victims in volleys of mutually supportive firepower.

stratagems.name: Gene-twisted Muscle
stratagems.target: One ABERRANTS, BIOPHAGUS or PURESTRAIN GENESTEALERS unit from your army that has not been selected to fight this phase.
stratagems.when: Fight phase.
stratagems.effect: Until the end of the phase, each time a model in your unit makes an attack that targets a MONSTER or VEHICLE, add 1 to the Wound roll.
stratagems.fluff: The raw strength of those infused with the Patriarch’s distilled power is undeniable when directed against the foe’s hulking tools of tyranny.

stratagems.name: Hyper-metabolic Vigour
stratagems.target: One ABERRANTS, BIOPHAGUS or PURESTRAIN GENESTEALERS unit from your army that has not been selected to fight this phase.
stratagems.when: Fight phase.
stratagems.effect: Until the end of the phase, each time a model in your unit makes a Pile-in or Consolidation move, it can move up to 6" instead of up to 3". In addition, it does not need to end that move closer to the closest enemy model, provided it ends it as close as possible to the closest enemy unit.
stratagems.fluff: Evidence of the bio-horror taint in their veins, the most blessed of a cult exhibit an inhuman swiftness.

stratagems.name: Stimulated Bio-surge
stratagems.target: One ABERRANTS, BIOPHAGUS or PURESTRAIN GENESTEALERS unit from your army that has not declared a charge this phase.
stratagems.when: Your Charge phase.
stratagems.effect: Until the end of the phase, each time your unit declares a charge, if the closest eligible enemy unit is selected as one of the targets of that charge, add 1 to the Charge roll for each selected target of that charge (including the closest eligible enemy unit), to a maximum of +3.
stratagems.fluff: Triggered by xenos bio-stimms flooding their bodies, when the cult’s predators spring their trap, the jaws close inescapably.

stratagems.name: Devoted Crew
stratagems.target: One GOLIATH ROCKGRINDER or GOLIATH TRUCK unit from your army that was selected as the target of one or more of the attacking unit’s attacks.
stratagems.when: Your opponent’s Shooting phase or the Fight phase, just after an enemy unit has selected its targets.
stratagems.effect: Until the end of the phase, each time an attack targets your unit, subtract 1 from the Damage characteristic of that attack.
stratagems.fluff: With evasive manoeuvres and split-second repairs, Outlander Claws marshal their rugged vehicles through the worst the foe can throw at them.

stratagems.name: Close-range Shoot-out
stratagems.target: One GENESTEALER CULTS MOUNTED or GENESTEALER CULTS VEHICLE unit from your army that has not been selected to shoot this phase.
stratagems.when: Your Shooting phase.
stratagems.effect: Until the end of the phase, ranged weapons equipped by models in your unit have the [LETHAL HITS] ability while targeting an enemy unit within 18".
stratagems.fluff: A cult’s experienced outriders are experts in hit-and-run attacks and close-range firefights. These skills are deadly when combined.

stratagems.name: Deft Manoeuvring
stratagems.target: One ACHILLES RIDGERUNNERS or ATALAN JACKALS unit from your army that was selected as the target of one or more of the attacking unit’s attacks.
stratagems.when: Your opponent’s Shooting phase, just after an enemy unit has selected its targets.
stratagems.effect: Until the end of the phase, models in your unit have a 4+ invulnerable save.
stratagems.fluff: Serpent-fast, jinking and swerving with incredible skill, the cult’s light vehicles appear to slide through the oppressor’s gunfire.

stratagems.name: Hyperferocity
stratagems.target: One GENESTEALER CULTS unit from your army that has not been selected to fight this phase.
stratagems.when: Fight phase.
stratagems.effect: Until the end of the phase, each time a model in your unit makes an attack that targets an enemy unit, re‑roll a Wound roll of 1. If one or more friendly TYRANIDS units are within 6" of that enemy unit, you can re‑roll the Wound roll instead.
stratagems.fluff: Goaded by the newly ascendant Hive Mind, the cultists fight with greater fury even as their muscles tear and organs rupture under the strain.

stratagems.name: Avenge the Star Children
stratagems.target: One TYRANIDS CHARACTER unit from your army that was destroyed by that enemy unit this phase. You can use this Stratagem on that unit even though it was just destroyed.
stratagems.when: Your opponent’s Shooting phase or the Fight phase, just after an enemy unit has shot or fought.
stratagems.effect: Until the end of the battle, each time a GENESTEALER CULTS model from your army makes an attack that targets that enemy unit, add 1 to the Hit roll and add 1 to the Wound roll.
stratagems.fluff: Some amongst the cult still retain enough sentience and zeal to feel rage and a need for vengeance if they see the Star Children slain.

stratagems.name: Divine Imperative
stratagems.target: One GENESTEALER CULTS unit from your army that has not declared a charge this phase.
stratagems.when: Your Charge phase.
stratagems.effect: Select one enemy unit within Engagement Range of one or more TYRANIDS units from your army. Until the end of the phase, each time your GENESTEALER CULTS unit declares a charge, if that enemy unit is one of the targets of that charge, add 1 to Charge rolls made for your unit and you can re‑roll the Charge roll.
stratagems.fluff: Cultists dash madly into the fighting without a care for their survival, drawn onward to aid the vanguard organisms by a will they cannot resist.

stratagems.name: Frenzied Devotion
stratagems.target: One ACOLYTE HYBRIDS, HYBRID METAMORPHS or NEOPHYTE HYBRIDS unit from your army that has not been selected to fight this phase.
stratagems.when: Fight phase.
stratagems.effect: Until the end of the phase, improve the Attacks and Weapon Skill characteristics of melee weapons equipped by models (excluding CHARACTERS) in your unit by 1 and those weapons have the [HAZARDOUS] ability.
stratagems.fluff: The faithful will gladly hurl themselves into harm’s way, frenziedly dragging the foe down.

stratagems.name: Primed and Readied
stratagems.target: One GENESTEALER CULTS units from your army that has not been selected to shoot or fight this phase.
stratagems.when: Your Shooting phase or the Fight phase.
stratagems.effect: Until the end of the phase, each time a model in your unit makes an attack, a Critical Hit is scored on an unmodified Hit roll of 5+, instead of only a 6.
stratagems.fluff: The broodkin have been trained and equipped for this moment, with weapons readied for Ascension.

stratagems.name: Coordinated Trap
stratagems.target: Two GENESTEALER CULTS units from your army that have not been selected to shoot or fight this phase.
stratagems.when: The start of your Shooting phase or the start of the Fight phase.
stratagems.effect: Select one enemy unit (if this Stratagem is used in the Fight phase, that enemy unit must be within Engagement Range of both of your units). Until the end of the phase, each time a model in either of your units makes an attack, it can only target that enemy unit (and only if it is an eligible target for that attack), and when resolving that attack, add 1 to the Wound roll.
stratagems.fluff: A tenet of guerrilla warfare is the concentration of even inferior firepower to inflict maximum harm.

stratagems.name: Saintly Paroxysm
stratagems.target: That destroyed CHARACTER model. You can use this Stratagem on that model even though it was just destroyed.
stratagems.when: Fight phase, just after an enemy unit destroys a GENESTEALER CULTS CHARACTER model from your army.
stratagems.effect: Roll one D6: on a 2+, that enemy unit suffers D3 mortal wounds. If that CHARACTER model is an ABOMINANT or PATRIARCH, that enemy unit suffers 2D3 mortal wounds instead.
stratagems.fluff: There are few more holy virtues in the cult’s eyes than to use one’s final act to lay low the oppressor.

stratagems.name: Vengeance for the Martyr!
stratagems.target: One other GENESTEALER CULTS CHARACTER model from your army.
stratagems.when: Your opponent’s Shooting phase or the Fight phase, just after an enemy unit destroys a GENESTEALER CULTS CHARACTER model from your army.
stratagems.effect: Until the end of the battle, each time a friendly ACOLYTE HYBRIDS, HYBRID METAMORPHS or NEOPHYTE HYBRIDS model makes an attack that targets that enemy unit, re-roll a Hit roll of 1. If the destroyed model was a MAGUS, PRIMUS or ACOLYTE ICONWARD, you can re-roll the Hit roll instead.
stratagems.fluff: Should one of the Patriarch’s inner coven fall, those that remain are swift to call for lethal retribution.

stratagems.name: In the Shadow of Iron
stratagems.target: One ASTRA MILITARUM VEHICLE unit from your army.
stratagems.when: Any phase, just after an enemy unit ends a move within 9" of one or more of your Cult Ambush markers.
stratagems.effect: Select one of those Cult Ambush markers. You can set up that Cult Ambush marker anywhere on the battlefield that is more than 9" horizontally away from all enemy units and wholly within 6" of your unit.
stratagems.fluff: Hulking armoured war engines provide ideal cover to launch a well-timed ambush.

stratagems.name: Regimental Reinforcements
stratagems.target: That INFANTRY unit. You can use this Stratagem on that unit even though it was just destroyed.
stratagems.when: Your opponent’s Shooting phase or the Fight phase, just after an ASTRA MILITARUM INFANTRY REGIMENT unit from your army (excluding ARTILLERY and CHARACTER units) is destroyed.
stratagems.effect: Roll one D6: on a 3+, place one Cult Ambush marker anywhere on the battlefield that is more than 9" horizontally away from all enemy units (if this is not possible, no marker is placed) and add a new unit to your army identical to your destroyed unit, in Cult Ambush, at its Starting Strength, with all of its wounds remaining and any [ONE SHOT] weapons those models are equipped with considered as not having been shot.
stratagems.fluff: Xeno-tainted soldiers have long learned to lurk in the shadows, ready to attack when the cult calls.

stratagems.name: Suppress and Overwhelm
stratagems.target: That ASTRA MILITARUM unit.
stratagems.when: Your Shooting phase, just after an ASTRA MILITARUM unit from your army has shot.
stratagems.effect: Select one enemy unit hit by one or more of those attacks. Until the end of the turn, that enemy unit cannot be targeted with the Fire Overwatch Stratagem and each time a GENESTEALER CULTS unit from your army selects that enemy unit as a target of a charge, you can re-roll the Charge roll.
stratagems.fluff: Disciplined salvoes of fire can drive the foe into cover, leaving them vulnerable to the rest of the cult.

stratagems.name: A Dark Network
stratagems.target: One ASTRA MILITARUM or GENESTEALER CULTS unit from your army (excluding MONSTERS and VEHICLES) within 12" of that enemy unit.
stratagems.when: Reinforcements step of your opponent’s Movement phase, just after an enemy unit is set up on the battlefield from Reserves.
stratagems.effect: Your unit can make a Normal move of up to 6".
stratagems.fluff: Forewarned of the enemy’s sudden onset by spies in their ranks or by the Brood Brothers’ own strategos, the cult’s faithful evade potential catastrophe.

stratagems.name: Evasive Vanguard
stratagems.target: One PURESTRAIN GENESTEALERS unit from your army in Cult Ambush.
stratagems.when: Any phase, just after an enemy unit ends a move within 9" of one or more of your Cult Ambush markers, before removing those markers from the battlefield.
stratagems.effect: Select one of those Cult Ambush markers. You can move that Cult Ambush marker up to 6". If that marker is still within 9" of one or more enemy units, it is removed from the battlefield; otherwise, until the end of the battle, you can only select PURESTRAIN GENESTEALERS units from your army to be set up using that Cult Ambush marker.
stratagems.fluff: Adaptive and intelligent, the purest of a cult’s broods can evade their foes to find new avenues of ingress.

stratagems.name: Bio-horror Revelation
stratagems.target: One ABERRANTS, BIOPHAGUS or PURESTRAIN GENESTEALERS unit from your army.
stratagems.when: Start of your opponent’s Shooting phase.
stratagems.effect: Until the end of the phase, each time an enemy unit within 9" of your unit is selected to shoot, it must take a Leadership test, subtracting 1 from the result. If that test is failed, until the end of the phase, each time a model in that enemy unit makes an attack that targets your unit, subtract 1 from the Hit roll.
stratagems.fluff: Face to face with hideous genetic monstrosities, their full horror can shake even the most stoic soul.

stratagems.name: Along Shadowed Trails
stratagems.target: One ATALAN JACKALS unit from your army in Cult Ambush.
stratagems.when: Any phase, just after an enemy unit ends a move within 9" of one or more of your Cult Ambush markers.
stratagems.effect: Select one of those Cult Ambush markers. You can set up that Cult Ambush marker anywhere on the battlefield that is more than 9" horizontally away from all enemy units and wholly within 6" of one or more battlefield edges. Until the end of the battle, you can only select ATALAN JACKALS units from your army to set up using that Cult Ambush marker.
stratagems.fluff: With raw speed and subtle misdirection, Atalan Jackals outflank those who believe them trapped.

stratagems.name: Rapid Feint
stratagems.target: One ACHILLES RIDGERUNNERS or ATALAN JACKALS unit from your army that is within 9" of that enemy unit.
stratagems.when: Your opponent’s Movement phase, just after an enemy unit ends a Normal, Advance or Fall Back move.
stratagems.effect: Your unit can make a Normal move of up to 6".
stratagems.fluff: An Outlander Claw’s skilled riders and crews can use their enhanced hybrid reactions to rapidly alter speed and course, roaring after fleeing prey or luring enemy out of position and leaving them flat-footed.

stratagems.name: Encircling the Prey
stratagems.target: One GENESTEALER CULTS MOUNTED or GENESTEALER CULTS VEHICLE unit from your army that is not within Engagement Range of one or more enemy units and is wholly within 9" of one or more battlefield edges.
stratagems.when: End of your opponent’s Fight phase.
stratagems.effect: Remove your unit from the battlefield and place it into Strategic Reserves.
stratagems.fluff: Skirting the edge of battle, an Outlander Claw’s raiders watch keenly for vulnerabilities, ready to throw themselves back into the fight to exploit any weaknesses in the enemy.

stratagems.name: Psi Surge
stratagems.target: One TYRANIDS unit from your army.
stratagems.when: Start of any phase.
stratagems.effect: Until the start of your next Command phase, increase the range of your unit’s Catalyst ability by 3.
stratagems.restrictions: Each time you use this Stratagem, until the end of your next Command phase, you cannot use this Stratagem again.
stratagems.fluff: As the Tyranid invasion gathers pace, the influence of the Hive Mind surges like waves rolling ever higher onto a desolate shore.

stratagems.name: Darting Attacks
stratagems.target: One TYRANIDS unit from your army.
stratagems.when: Your Shooting phase or your Charge phase.
stratagems.effect: Until the end of the phase, your unit is eligible to shoot and declare a charge in a turn in which it Fell Back.
stratagems.fluff: Like predatory sea beasts lunging from wheeling shoals of fish, the vanguard organisms strike and fade from amidst the cultist hordes repeatedly, picking apart their overwhelmed prey.

stratagems.name: Resistance Tunnels
stratagems.target: One GENESTEALER CULTS or TYRANIDS unit from your army that is not within Engagement Range of one or more enemy units.
stratagems.when: End of your opponent’s Fight phase.
stratagems.effect: Remove your unit from the battlefield and place it into Strategic Reserves.
stratagems.fluff: Never again will the tunnel networks of the cult provide secret roads for hopeful and idealistic freedom fighters. Yet they can still serve one last time as a means by which the Tyranids and their surviving worshippers can vanish from the battlefield only to strike again elsewhere.

stratagems.name: Tireless Fervour
stratagems.target: One ACOLYTE HYBRIDS, HYBRID METAMORPHS or NEOPHYTE HYBRIDS unit from your army that has not declared a charge this phase.
stratagems.when: Your Charge phase.
stratagems.effect: Until the end of the phase, your unit is eligible to declare a charge in a turn in which it Advanced or Fell Back. When doing so, if it targets an enemy unit within Engagement Range of one or more friendly CHARACTER units, you can re-roll the Charge roll.
stratagems.fluff: When the cult’s leaders demand devotion, danger and exhaustion are forgotten in the rush to serve.

stratagems.name: Transcendent Celerity
stratagems.target: One ACOLYTE HYBRIDS, HYBRID METAMORPHS or NEOPHYTE HYBRIDS unit from your army that has not been selected to shoot this phase.
stratagems.when: Your Shooting phase.
stratagems.effect: Until the end of the phase, ranged weapons equipped by models in your unit have the [ASSAULT] ability.
stratagems.fluff: Owing to their hypersensory reactions, the cult’s rate of fire increases.

stratagems.name: The Path of Anguish
stratagems.target: One ACOLYTE HYBRIDS or NEOPHYTE HYBRIDS unit from your army that had one or more of its models destroyed as a result of the attacking unit’s attacks.
stratagems.when: Your opponent’s Shooting phase, just after an enemy unit has shot.
stratagems.effect: Your unit can make a move of up to D6", but it unit must end that move as close as possible to the closest enemy unit (excluding AIRCRAFT). When doing so, models in your unit can be moved within Engagement Range of that enemy unit.
stratagems.fluff: Bloody persecution by the oppressors is grist for the mill of the cult’s violent and zealous creed.

stratagems.name: Tunnel Crawlers
stratagems.target: One GENESTEALER CULTS unit from your army that is arriving using the Deep Strike ability this phase.
stratagems.when: Your Movement phase.
stratagems.effect: Your unit can be set up anywhere on the battlefield that is more than 6" horizontally away from all enemy units.
stratagems.restrictions: A unit targeted by this Stratagem is not eligible to declare a charge in the same turn.
stratagems.fluff: The cult can expertly assail seemingly impregnable enemy positions.

stratagems.name: Lying in Wait
stratagems.target: One GENESTEALER CULTS BATTLELINE unit from your army in Cult Ambush.
stratagems.when: Your opponent’s Movement phase.
stratagems.effect: Until the end of the phase, when setting your unit up using a Cult Ambush marker, set your unit up anywhere on the battlefield wholly within 6" of that Cult Ambush marker and not within Engagement Range of one or more enemy units.
stratagems.fluff: The brood lurks invisibly as the enemy approaches. Not until the last second do they burst from cover to strike.

stratagems.name: Return to the Shadows
stratagems.target: One GENESTEALER CULTS INFANTRY unit from your army that was selected as the target of one or more of the attacking unit’s attacks.
stratagems.when: Your opponent’s Shooting phase, just after an enemy unit has shot.
stratagems.effect: Remove your unit from the battlefield and place it into Strategic Reserves.
stratagems.fluff: With their task of drawing the oppressors’ fire complete, the surviving cultists melt away, ready to strike again.

stratagems.name: A Deadly Snare
stratagems.target: One GENESTEALER CULTS INFANTRY unit from your army that was selected as a target of that charge.
stratagems.when: Your opponent’s Charge phase, just after an enemy unit declares a charge.
stratagems.effect: Roll one D6: on a 2-4, that enemy unit suffers D3 mortal wounds; on a 5+, that enemy unit suffers 3 mortal wounds.
stratagems.fluff: An enemy’s fervour to strike down the faithful of the cult can be turned against them, luring the foe into a region laced with hidden traps and primed explosives.

stratagems.name: Acceptable Losses
stratagems.target: One ASTRA MILITARUM unit from your army.
stratagems.when: Your Shooting phase.
stratagems.effect: Select one enemy unit within Engagement Range of one or more GENESTEALER CULTS units from your army. Until the end of the phase, your unit can make ranged attacks that target that enemy unit. If it does, after it has resolved those attacks, roll one D6 for each of those GENESTEALER CULTS units: on a 5+, the unit being rolled for suffers D3+1 mortal wounds.
stratagems.fluff: With martial pragmatism and the cult’s victory at stake, Brood Brothers will willingly open fire on the foe even if it endangers infiltrating cells of allies.

stratagems.name: The Downtrodden Rise
stratagems.target: One ACOLYTE HYBRIDS, HYBRID METAMORPHS or NEOPHYTE HYBRIDS unit from your army in Cult Ambush.
stratagems.when: End of the Reinforcements step of your opponent’s Movement phase, if you have no Cult Ambush markers on the battlefield.
stratagems.effect: This phase, you can set up your unit on the battlefield without using a Cult Ambush marker. When doing so, set up your unit anywhere on the battlefield that is more than 9" horizontally away from all enemy units, not within your opponent’s deployment zone, and wholly within 9" of one or more battlefield edges.
stratagems.fluff: Such is the creed’s inspirational call to arms that as the foe foil one incursion, another rises for the cause.
